intro: Papaver dubium var. maculatum, commonly known as the spotted poppy, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its striking, vibrant red petals with distinctive black spots, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a slender stem and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
